security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill containing only code review checklists, templates, and best practices. No executable code, network calls, file system access beyond reading its own markdown files, or external command execution capabilities. All TypeScript code snippets are embedded examples for illustration purposes only.

content.value_statement: Code reviews are inconsistent and time-consuming without clear standards. This skill provides structured checklists, conventional comments patterns, and feedback templates to ensure thorough, constructive reviews that improve code quality and team collaboration.
actual_capabilities: Provides comprehensive code review checklists for multiple languages
Defines conventional comments format with severity labels
Includes PR and feedback templates for consistent reviews
Offers security, performance, and testing review guidelines
Suggests review metrics and goals for team improvement
Contains TypeScript code patterns for extended AI analysis
limitations: Does not execute or validate code directly
Does not integrate with version control systems
Does not automatically detect code issues
Templates require manual completion and customization

use_cases.title: Review pull requests
use_cases.description: Systematically review code changes using checklists for quality, security, performance, and testing

use_cases.title: Establish review standards
use_cases.description: Create consistent code review practices across the team with conventional comments and templates

use_cases.title: Learn review practices
use_cases.description: Understand how to give and receive constructive feedback through structured guidelines

prompt_templates.title: Quick review request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this pull request for code quality, error handling, and test coverage. Use conventional comments format.

prompt_templates.title: Security focus review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security review of this code. Check for authentication, authorization, injection vulnerabilities, and sensitive data handling.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this PR for architectural soundness, design patterns, separation of concerns, and scalability.

prompt_templates.title: Full team review
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a complete code review including executive summary, detailed feedback, security review, and approval decision using the review feedback template.

best_practices: Provide specific, actionable feedback with concrete code suggestions
Use conventional comments labels (praise, issue, suggestion, question) to indicate comment type
Review code within 24 hours to maintain team velocity
Distinguish blocking issues from nice-to-have suggestions
anti_patterns: Blocking on personal preferences rather than objective issues
Submitting large PRs exceeding 400 lines without context
Rewriting code in comments instead of suggesting improvements

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All three support conventional comments and review templates.

faq.question: What is the maximum PR size for effective review?
faq.answer: Keep PRs under 400 lines for focused reviews. Large PRs over 800 lines should be split into smaller, logical chunks.

faq.question: How do I integrate templates with GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: Copy the PR template content to .github/pull_request_template.md or .gitlab/merge_request_templates/MR_TEMPLATE.md.

faq.question: Is my code data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is purely prompt-based documentation. It does not execute code, access files, or transmit data externally.

faq.question: Why are my review comments being ignored?
faq.answer: Ensure comments are specific and actionable. Use conventional labels. Distinguish blocking issues from suggestions. Follow up promptly.

faq.question: How does this compare to automated code analysis tools?
faq.answer: This skill guides human reviewers through systematic checks. Automated tools (ESLint, SonarQube) handle formatting and simple checks. Human review catches logic, design, and context issues.
